comment: Dr. Carlson gives you work that isnt always clearly written out and explained well enough. Her grading is super tough. Each week we had a couple of readings and most of the time they were confusing. She didnt post any lecture videos or explain in detail what the readings were about. Definitely would not take her for an online class ever again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: She is a tough grader. Her discussion post questions are vague at times and when you answer the questions to the best of your ability, she will give you low grades because they aren't what she was expecting. She is not a good professor and I would not take her if I were you.

Dr. Carlson is a great professor however, I did not care much for her course. There are a lot of readings, but most are unnecessary. Her grading is a tad tough. She's a law professor but grades like an advance placement literature professor. She cares A LOT about grammar & punctuation. Heavy work loads, use your time wisely and PROOF READ!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: The class was really interesting but the tests were tough if you only studied day of.. I highly recommend going to class and taking notes about the lectures, a lot of that is on the exams. You have to get a Twitter and post stuff for the course throughout the semester. One presentation, 3 law briefs, 3 tests. Uploads grades to D2L frequently.
rating_tags: SO MANY PAPERS--Tests are tough--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I dropped one of Prof Carlson's classes before, COM 2135, because I was scared I wouldn't do well. But if you're taking her for Media Law, don't worry - she is a great prof & teaches well! lectures are very laid back - but just do the (easy) writing assignments, pay attention in lecture & study hard for the tests and you'll do great!!

Prof. Carlson is boring, but she has been in the industry for a long time and knows what she is talking about. A lot of busy work, but it helps with your writing if you actually do it. Just 3 articles for the semester and midterm and final. Do NOT forget a photo with each article (taken by you) and sources contact info.

She is very nice, but the class is somewhat of a bore. She does offer proof-reading assignments before due dates, but unless you are actually interested in journalism I wouldn't recommend the class. For Comm majors (not interested in journalism) who have a choice in taking this or two other writing competency courses I'd recommend something else.

She is by far one of the best professors at KSU. She genuinely cares for the students to learn and understand their mistakes. She allows you to turn in major assignments one day prior to deadline and she edits them. How can you possibly get a bad grade? I would highly recommend her

She is a little boring, but she really knows what she's talking about. The hardest part of her class was the quiz portion. You definitely need to buy an AP style book; I didn't because I thought I could find the answers online but I always got bad grades on my quizzes. Also always turn in your assignments a day early! That made up for my quizzes.

Yes she is a little dull; ok she's pretty boring but she knows her stuff!  Her professional experience speaks for itself. She'll review your work before you turn it in which makes it  impossible to get a bad grade. If you fail the class or don't make the C requirement you honestly just didn't try because her class is set up for everyone to succeed.

Excellent teacher. Grades hard but she grades your work before you turn it in. The only reason you would fell the class is if you dont come or you dont seek her help. I like her shes a tough cookie but a good one in my book. Taking her again for Com 4470 Media Law

No ppts, soft-spoken, class can be boring. take advantage of her proofreading before turning in papers. do the hw & do it well, they can bring you down a letter grade. Get the book, test q's come right from it. She's a very nice person, and very helpful.. her teaching style in class is just boring.

Absolute WORST experience with a professor at KSU. On my junior year EXTREMELY DULL and A TON of homework and outside writing. She will proofread your work (major assignments 3) before you turn them in. But it's not worth it!! Use the writing lab and get a different prof.!

The good thing is that she will proofread your work before you turn it in so you'll likely get a good grade. Thats it. The class is a BORE! She's not very lively and she speaks softly. Few visual aids. You just have to listen to her speak. Its hard to stay awake. She's not a bad person, just boring. If possible, take someone else.

She will proofread your paper before you have to turn it in. And she's helpful for the most part. BUT she is really mean about answering questions. She doesn't answer, she just stares a hole in your head. She embarrasses people by making their questions sound stupid instead of answering it like a professor. She's like a pretentious IT guy.

DO NOT TAKE! REPEAT: DO NOT TAKE. She is the most boring, drawn out, dullest teacher i have had at Kennesaw State. She reads her lectures straight out of the book. No powerpoints, no activities in class, no fun what so ever!! The only plus is that she will proof-read your papers for you.
